tourName: Game count safari at Hwange National Park, Zimbabwe
generalInfo:
Unlike a typical safari, which lasts just a few hours, the Game Count Safari immerses guests in Hwange’s wilderness for a full 24-hour period. Stationed at a designated waterhole, participants track a diverse array of species, from vast herds of elephants and elusive predators to rarely seen nocturnal animals.

Morning to afternoon offers the chance to witness antelope, giraffes, and warthogs as they arrive for their first drink of the day. As the sun begins to set, predators start to stir, and the landscape transforms with the calls of night birds and the distant roar of lions. Through the night, guided by the moon and the quiet sounds of the bush, the nocturnal world comes to life. By dawn, the park awakens again with the sounds of the wild, marking the conclusion of an unforgettable conservation experience.

This unique adventure is available exclusively for guests staying at selected safari camps.

The Game Count happens over 24 hours, but is part of a 3 night stay at a lodge which includes game drives on the other days.

dayInfo.description: Transfer to Hwange National Park for 3 nights on safari. Hwange National Park is Zimbabwe's largest game reserve. Vast stretches of wilderness, extend from horizon to horizon and form part of the ancient migration route towards Northern Botswana's Chobe and the Linyanti. This diverse landscape of mopane and teak forests, semi-desert scrubland and granite hills is inhabited by a wide variety of mammals and birds. Although a year round destination, Hwange is particularly appealing during the winter months (April to October) when large concentrations of animals flock to artificially pumped waterholes as the seasonal pans dry out. The park's network of waterholes sustains life when natural resources are unavailable. Massive herds of elephant make their presence felt during the dry period. Buffalo, zebra, sable and roan antelope, as well as lion, leopard, cheetah and wild dog can are also to be seen. Stay in an intimate camp with a feeling of remoteness and seclusion. Rooms boast views of a productive waterhole which draws local wildlife. Elles are often drawn to the pool right at the front of the lodge for a drink on a hot day: it’s an incredible privilege to be so close to these magnificent giants. During the day, game drives will have you tracking lion prides, buffalo herds, and learning about the work of the local wild dog conservation centre – a visit to the centre is an absolute must to hear the story of how dogs are being brought back from near-extinction in this area. Guests can also visit local village and conservation projects which are funded by the Lodge’s Trust. This is a very special place: prepare to be immersed in the wilderness and friendliness of the local people.

Your designated Game Count Day. At 12 PM, you’ll be taken to your assigned waterhole, where you’ll spend 24 hours monitoring and recording wildlife movements. As night falls, the full moon illuminates the landscape, revealing the hidden world of Hwange’s nocturnal creatures. You’ll work in shifts, keeping a meticulous record of every animal that visits, while soaking in the unforgettable experience of Africa’s wilderness at its most raw and authentic.
Spend the day relaxing at the Camp Waterhole, or take a morning and afternoon game drive, returning to camp for sundowners and dinner.

Transfer to Victoria Falls Airport for onward travel arrangements. You could fly down to Cape Town for time in the Mother City, or travel on to Botswana for a very special safari or 2-3 night boat safari.

tourName: Hwange safari in Zimbabwe, tailor made
generalInfo:
This trip is available from the 1st of April to the 31st of December and offers a six-night safari adventure in Zimbabwe's Hwange National Park, starting with three nights at Deteema Springs, followed by three nights at Verney's Camp.

Everything we do is completely tailor-made so should you like to amend this trip at all, perhaps by adding on a few days to explore Victoria Falls or further exploration of Zimbabwe just let us know.

Both camps provide a luxurious and immersive experience in the heart of one of Africa's premier wildlife destinations. The journey begins at Deteema Springs, located in the northern part of the park, where guests can enjoy a traditional safari experience with comfortable tented accommodations overlooking a natural waterhole. This area is renowned for its diverse wildlife, including large herds of elephants, lions, buffalo, and numerous bird species. Activities include morning and evening game drives, guided walking safaris, and bird watching, all designed to maximize wildlife viewing opportunities and provide intimate encounters with nature.

After exploring Deteema Springs, the adventure continues at Verney's Camp, situated in a private concession in the southeastern part of Hwange National Park. Verney's Camp offers luxurious tents that blend seamlessly into the environment, providing exclusive access to diverse wildlife and scenic landscapes. Guests can partake in game drives within the private concession, experience the bush on foot through walking safaris, and engage with local communities through cultural visits. The camp also offers stargazing sessions under the clear African skies. This itinerary combines thrilling wildlife encounters with relaxation and cultural insights, making it an unforgettable safari experience in one of Africa's most iconic wilderness areas.

dayInfo.description: From Victoria Falls Airport you will meet an internal flight to Hwange National Park where upon arrival you will be met and driven the short distance to Deteema Springs.
Enjoy two full days on safari with the expert team at Deteema Springs. It is a rugged and undulating area in contrast to the plains and forest stands further south. Explore on foot and by game drive.

You will enjoy a game drive transfer through the park to your next safari camp - Verney's Camp. Enjoy an afternoon activity and your first chance to explore another area of the vast Hwange National Park.
Located in a private concession Verney's offers an exclusive experience in which to explore by walking safaris and game drives over the next two days.
Finally after a morning safari activity you will be taken to the local airstrip to fly back to Victoria Falls. Where next?

tourName: Victoria Falls, Hwange and Mana Pools, Zimbabwe
generalInfo:
Embark on an unforgettable safari adventure visiting three of Zimbabwe top destinations, Victoria Falls, Hwange National Park and Mana Pools National Park.

Due to the seasonality of Mana Pools National Park, this itinerary is available from May to the end of October. If you are looking to travel outside of these dates please do enquire as we can suggest tweaks to the itinerary or another trip which will work for you. Everything we do is tailor-made so should you like to make any changes to the trip we can discuss this during the quoting process.

The itinerary begins at the awe-inspiring Victoria Falls - a UNESCO World Heritage Site and world's largest continuous sheet of falling water.

Next, spend three nights at Deteema Springs in Hwange National Park, indulging in game drives and walking safaris to witness elephants, lions, and other wildlife. Conclude your journey with three nights at Mana River Camp in Mana Pools National Park, featuring canoe safaris on the Zambezi River, close encounters with buffalo and elephants, and exploring the stunning landscape on game drives and walking safaris.

This trip offers a perfect blend of breathtaking scenery, thrilling wildlife encounters, and luxury but authentic accommodations.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Victoria Falls you will be met at the airport and driven to Nkosi Guest Lodge to spend two nights while you explore the area.

You have a full day to explore Victoria Falls, while it is easy to explore independently we can also add any activities to experience the area further. For example a boat cruise, helicopter trip or community visit.

You will be picked up from Victoria Falls and driven to Hwange National Park for the start of your six night on safari in the first of Zimbabwe iconic national park you'll be visiting. Deteema Springs in the north of the park is your base for the next three nights.
Explore northern Hwange on included activities with your camp, you have both game drives and nature walks included with the expert local guides based at Deteema Springs.

From Hwange you will fly to the stunningly beautiful Mana Pools National Park - just across the Zambezi from Zambia's Lower Zambezi National Park. You'll be picked up at the airstrip by the team from Mana River Camp and driven to camp, where you will stay for the next three nights.

As well as game drives and nature walks, from Mana River Camp, it is also possible to go canoeing and given the camps location right on the banks of the Zambezi you may not need to go out at all for fantastic wildlife viewing.
Finally you eight-night adventure through Zimbabwe comes to end as you fly to Harare to meet your onward flight arrangements.

tourName: Victoria Falls photography holiday, Zimbabwe
generalInfo:
This is an exciting opportunity to get up-close encounters with wildlife, collect a stacked portfolio of pics, improve your skills with a camera, and get all the other benefits of a photo safari, all whilst contributing to good causes.

This program sends you to a game reserve and wildlife sanctuary on the border of Zimbabwe’s Zambezi National Park. There, you’ll spend 2-12 weeks exploring the region through a range of safari experiences and making the most of the fantastic wildlife photography opportunities. What’s more, you’ll get real-world experience as a conservation photographer and take on assignments documenting conservation activities at the wildlife sanctuary. You’ll be taking incredible photographs, building your skills as a photographer, and helping to raise awareness and support for the important work being done at the sanctuary. On top of all that, you’ll be a short distance from one of Victoria Falls and enjoy all the photo ops of one of the wonders of the world.

You’ll live and work in the game reserve, so you’ll have unrestricted access to the wildlife. There’s a stunning array of wildlife in the area too. You’ll find excellent opportunities to photograph elephants, lions, leopards, zebras, giraffes, hippos, and many different species of antelope. The area you’ll stay is particularly well-known for sightings of lions and spotted hyenas. As well as its larger wildlife, The park boasts diverse bird species, including African fish eagles, herons, kingfishers, and many more. Plus, lying in the reserve, you’ll be able to enjoy a range of safari experiences like walking safaris, boat cruises, and traditional game drives.

Meanwhile, your engagement with the sanctuary’s activity will grant you unique insights into the area's wildlife. You’ll get the chance to observe and photograph wildlife rescue operations, surgeries, and a host of other site-specific occurrences. Beyond the unique experiences they’ll grant you, these assignments are a unique bonus for a photography program. This could be your chance to see what it's like to work as a jobbing photographer, make valuable additions to an early career portfolio, and most of all, give back to the wildlife you'll be photographing. This sanctuary does valuable work protecting the area's flora and fauna, and your images could help connect them with support.

As if all that wasn’t enough, you’ll be only a short drive from one of the wonders of the world, Victoria Falls. This comes with its wealth of photo opportunities as well as some activities for your downtime. You could enjoy horse rides along the Zambezi River, helicopter tours, or river cruises and canoe trips.

tourName: Zimbabwe camping safari
generalInfo:
This ten-day safari captures the very best of Zimbabwe, taking you from the game-rich plains of Hwange to the vast waters of Lake Kariba and the wild floodplains of Mana Pools. It’s a journey through three contrasting landscapes, each with its own character, rhythm and charm – and together they tell the story of one of Africa’s most remarkable safari destinations.

Your adventure begins in Hwange National Park, where elephants gather in their thousands and lions roam across open savannah. Days here are filled with classic safari moments, from dawn game drives to evenings spent watching wildlife at the waterhole from the comfort of camp. From Hwange, you’ll fly north to Lake Kariba, a landscape of endless horizons, fiery sunsets and peaceful boat cruises where hippos snort in the shallows and fish eagles call overhead.

The journey ends in Mana Pools, a UNESCO World Heritage Site renowned for its walking safaris, Zambezi views and concentration of big game. Staying in a trio of authentic, characterful camps – The Hide, Changa Safari Camp and John’s Camp – you’ll enjoy warm hospitality, outstanding guiding and an atmosphere that feels both relaxed and deeply connected to nature. This is a safari that celebrates the true spirit of Zimbabwe: wild, welcoming and wonderfully unspoiled.

dayInfo.description: Fly from Victoria Falls to Hwange. Transfer to The Hide, your base for the next three nights. Settle into your tent overlooking a busy waterhole and enjoy an afternoon game drive or relax on the deck as elephants come to drink.

Spend your days exploring Hwange by vehicle or on foot with expert guides. Expect herds of elephant, buffalo and an array of predators. Sundowners and hide photography sessions are a highlight. Evenings are spent sharing stories around the fire.

Fly to Lake Kariba and transfer to Changa Safari Camp. Relax by the pool or enjoy an afternoon boat cruise. The camp’s lake views and teak-crafted interiors create a perfect retreat after your flight.

Rise early for game drives, walking safaris or fishing for tigerfish. Later, cruise through the beautiful Sanyati Gorge and watch the sunset over the water. Birdlife is prolific and the scenery outstanding.
After breakfast, fly to Mana Pools. Transfer to John’s Camp on the Zambezi floodplain and settle in for three nights in one of Africa’s most scenic parks.
Enjoy walking safaris, game drives and riverbank sundowners. The area teems with elephants, hippos and wild dogs. Evenings end around the campfire under the stars.
Fly from Mana Pools to Harare or Victoria Falls for your onward journey.

tourName: Zimbabwe holidays, tailormade
placesVisited: Harare, Victoria Falls, Matopo Hills, Great Zimbabwe, Eastern Highlands
generalInfo:
This wonderful tailor made itinerary to Zimbabwe takes in the highlights of this beautiful country. Zimbabwe offers an outstanding variety of natural beauty and spectacular scenery. The country holds great appeal for adventurous travellers, outdoor enthusiasts and wildlife admirers.

From the majesty of the famous Victoria Falls to the giant marble-like boulders of the Matopo Hills, the verdant mountains of the Eastern Highlands and the national parks teeming with wildlife to the Great Zimbabwe ancient ruins and the capital city Harare.

Your accommodation is small luxury lodges throughout, the majority with all game drives, food and drinks included, making this trip excellent value-for-money. Visit Zimbabwe now, before the crowds!

dayInfo.description: Arrive Zimbabwe - please ask us for flight options. You will be met on arrival and transferred to your hotel in Harare to freshen up. Additional visit to the Imire rhino breeding programme, situated outside Harare. Evening at leisure and overnight.

Today we take a short tour of Harare, visiting the Botanical Gardens, the National Gallery and National Archives before traveling onto Great Zimbabwe. The Great Zimbabwe Ruins are Africa's most important and largest ruins - check-in to your lodge for overnight. Overnight: Lodge at the Ancient City, Great Zimbabwe

After breakfast, an expert historical guide will take you through the ancient capital of Zimbabwe. Continue to Gweru and then into the Antelope Park Game Reserve for wildlife spotting and game drives. You can take time to canoe on the tranquil lake. Overnight: Gweru River Tent, Antelope Park

Gweru - Walk with Lions Today is very special as you will visit the research, rehabilitation and release programme at Gweru. You can take a horse ride through the game reserve and observe the animals in their own environment. Overnight: Gweru River Tent

Leave Antelope Park this morning and travel to Bulawayo in the centre of Zimbabwe. You will be met on arrival and transferred to the sophisticated Bulawayo Club. Enjoy a walking tour of the city, visit the Railway Museum and National Art Gallery. Overnight: Bulawayo Club

Matopos - Set off after breakfast for the remarkable Matopo Hills National Park where you can choose a host of activities including rhino tracking on foot, game drives in the park or sundowners against the magnificent boulders. There are some excellent examples of cave paintings here. Overnight: Camp Amalinda
Today is free to explore the Matopo National Park with a plethora of options. Overnight: Camp Amalinda

Depart this morning after breakfast for Hwange, Zimbabwe's most famous National Park. Your stay includes two game drives daily with highly qualified rangers. Your small intimate lodge has only 7 rooms. Ivory Lodge is a place of elephants and expect herds of elephants here, sometimes over 100 strong. Overnight: Ivory Lodge
Today is spent exploring Hwange National Park with game drives and activities included. Overnight: Ivory Lodge

Today we visit the splendour of Victoria Falls - one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World. At 1708 metres wide it is the largest curtain of water in the world. There is a sunset cruise on the Zambezi River this evening, where you can relax witha sundowner and take in the view! Overnight: Victoria Falls Safari Lodge

After breakfast, enjoy a guided tour of the Falls and the traditional village. Visit the spectacular Devil's Cataract, Main Falls as well as the Horseshoe Falls. At the village, you have the option to purchase local handicrafts. Take afternoon tea at the famous Victoria Falls Hotel. Overnight: Victoria Falls Safari Lodge
Depart today and transfer to the airport for your departure flight.

tourName: Zimbabwe safari holiday, tailor made
placesVisited: Victoria Falls, Linkwasha Concession, Hwange National Park, Hwange safari camp experience, Changa safari camp, Matusadona National Park, Lake Kariba, Great African Rift Valley, Zambezi River, Mana Pools National Park, Potential wildlife spotting might include: elephants, buffalos, hippos, waterbucks, lions, leopards, and endangered wild dogs
generalInfo:
This exciting eight day safari provides access to some of Zimbabwe’s wildlife abundant national parks and protected private concessions.

Diversity and variety is certainly the spice of life and this tailor made tour provides plenty of both. From elephants and leopards in Hwange National Park to lions and hyenas around Lake Kariba, Zimbabwe features a wealth of indigenous wildlife, as well as flocks of migratory and native species of birds.

Luxury safari camps provide comfortable accommodation as well as ample opportunities to continue to keep an eye out for animals with settings in Mana Pools National Park, overlooking the Zambezi River, allowing guests to dine, stargaze and even take a bath with a front row view.

Efficient scheduled charter flights make short shrift of distances as part of this tailor made itinerary to ensure you get more time on the ground in Zimbabwe within three of the country’s most diverse regions.

dayInfo.description: A scheduled flight from Kariba to Mana West Airstrip and a short road transfer will take you to Ruckomechi Camp. This camp is idyllically located, overlooking the Zambezi River and the imposing Great African Rift Valley. Ruckomechi Camp is situated in an exclusive concession of Mana Pools National Park, in the heart of the Zambezi Valley. The setting of Ruckomechi, located amongst a large grove of acacia and ebony trees, allows for exploration of the rich and varied wildlife. An intoxicating blend of wildlife and bird species abound. The dry season sees large herds of elephant and buffalo together with hippo, waterbuck, kudu, nyala and eland all seeking to slake their thirst along the banks of the mighty Zambezi. Predators follow with lions frequenting the floodplains and adjacent woodland, while leopard stalk the thickets. Cheetah and endangered wild dog are also often seen. The area is equally famous for its superb birdlife, offering over 350 species including collared palm-thrush and African skimmer. Ten spacious en-suite tents, including a honeymoon suite and family room, maximise views of the Zambezi River and the escarpment beyond. Each has both indoor and outdoor showers, and the camp boasts an outdoor ‘bath-with-a-view’ in a secluded, scenic spot. A central dining, bar, library and main area complete the camp offering. There is a separate deck with infinity pool for swimming and sun bathing, and an inviting, cushion-strewn sundowner and stargazing deck.
Return to Victoria Falls Airport (or Harare) by light aircraft for your onward arrangements

tourName: Zimbabwe safari tour, tailor made
generalInfo:
Zimbabwe is a bit off-the-beaten-track, but offers superb adventures and experiences, particularly for families with older teens looking to combine history, culture, safari and adventure.

Expert guiding ensures visitors can experience a safari and tours which provide an in-depth discovery and understanding. This means so much more than just seeing what's on the surface.

On this trip, explore ancient rock art sites, track rhino on foot, watch elephants drink from a waterhole from your lodge swimming pool. On safari, visit a local clinic, and sit in a hide and watch as animal approach up close, unaware of your presence. At the Victoria Falls, indulge in any number of adrenaline activities: a gorge swing, canopy tour, white water rafting ... take a bike ride to a local village, have lunch or dinner at a vibrant township restaurant, watch the sunset from a boat. A trip to build memories to last forever.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Bulawayo Airport and transfer to your lodge for 3 nights in Matobo Hills. A landscape like no other, Matobo Hills' ancient granite kopjes, wooded valleys and weirdly balanced rock formations offer a unique experience. Mysterious and beautiful, this World Heritage Site is located 40 kms south of Bulawayo and is an area of massive spiritual and cultural significance to local people. Millions of years of erosion and weathering has hewn shapes from granite rock and these gravity-defying formations point to the skies above, as though in communion with the elements responsible for sculpting them. Stay in this lodge, owned by a Zimbabwean family, who are actively involved in local community and environmental projects, which you can visit and see first hand how tourism is benefiting the locals. Cycle to a rural village: you will have an opportunity to interact with locals through an interpreter to hear the challenges of living in post-Mugabe-era Zimbabwe: how unemployment means that parents have to leave children to be looked after by grand-parents, the reality of a system that doesn’t provide free education or healthcare – and how poaching has affected wildlife. The people are so very friendly, and though previously not happy to talk politics for fear of reprisals, they are now very open and critical of their recent past. Lodge activities include: nature drives, rhino tracking by vehicle and on foot, a visit Cecil John Rhodes grave where you will hear the history of Zimbabwe and how Zimbabweans still revere Rhodes, cycling to a rural village, hear about ingenious projects that have benefited from the Lodge’s Trust donations, such as fence-building to combat poaching, widows provided with chickens, whose eggs are then purchased by the Lodge’s kitchen – then providing a family with income - and visits to ancient rock art sites to learn about the significance of these ancient paintings.

Transfer to Hwange National Park for 3 nights on safari. Hwange National Park is Zimbabwe's largest game reserve. Vast stretches of wilderness, extend from horizon to horizon and form part of the ancient migration route towards Northern Botswana's Chobe and the Linyanti. This diverse landscape of mopane and teak forests, semi-desert scrubland and granite hills is inhabited by a wide variety of mammals and birds. Although a year round destination, Hwange is particularly appealing during the winter months (April to October) when large concentrations of animals flock to artificially pumped waterholes as the seasonal pans dry out. The park's network of waterholes sustains life when natural resources are unavailable. Massive herds of elephant make their presence felt during the dry period. Buffalo, zebra, sable and roan antelope, as well as lion, leopard, cheetah and wild dog can are also to be seen. Stay in an intimate camp with a feeling of remoteness and seclusion. Rooms boast views of a productive waterhole which draws local wildlife. Elles are often drawn to the pool right at the front of the lodge for a drink on a hot day: it’s an incredible privilege to be so close to these magnificent giants. During the day, game drives will have you tracking lion prides, buffalo herds, and learning about the work of the local wild dog conservation centre – a visit to the centre is an absolute must to hear the story of how dogs are being brought back from near-extinction in this area. Guests can also visit local village and conservation projects which are funded by the Lodge’s Trust. This is a very special place: prepare to be immersed in the wilderness and friendliness of the local people.

Transfer to Victoria Falls for 3 nights in a local guesthouse style lodge. When you wander through the lush rainforests above the Victoria Falls, newly baptised in the mist, your ears holding the echo of thundering waters, it isn't hard to imagine that this is where it all began. Eden. As the land cuts away beneath the ancient Zambezi River, the waters plummet dramatically into the Batoka Gorge, over 100 metres below. The angrily churned up spray shoots skyward, painting the landscape in billowing clouds. This striking "smoke that thunders" can be seen for miles, a geographic pointer summoning visitors into its presence. The Victoria Falls reaches its zenith in about May each year. It is a truly awe-inspiring experience - the sight, the sound, the smell and the humbling feeling that here indeed, is Natures Supreme Masterpiece. No photograph can begin to depict the reality and nothing prepares you for your first sight. Remember to hire a raincoat when the Falls are at their peak: you will otherwise be soaked! One evening, take a sunset cruise to enjoy possible sightings of hippo, crocodile, elephant and a variety of birds. With sundowner in hand marvel at the beauty of an African sunset - a perfect end to a great day. During the day, perhaps take an 'Insider Host' tour. An 'Insider Host' gives guests an opportunity to meet real people and understand what makes Victoria Falls tick...from an 'Insiders' perspective. This is an activity with a difference and not something visitors can experience by wandering around town on their own or by booking any of the many activity-based excursions on offer. The Insider Host lives in Victoria Falls, has been part of the Victoria Falls scene from many years, knows lots of interesting locals and, if need be, can make things happen. She/he can also talk about anything and everything Zimbabwe-related: another opportunity to learn about the effects of living in a country devastated by a tyrant. Your time with the Insider Guide is flexible - we always recommend starting at the Tour of the Falls and then, depending on the guests' interests, they could visit an art gallery, do a drive though Chinotimba Township or visit the Elephant Walk Shopping & Artists Village. Other activities on offer include cycling trips to local villages, bungy jumping, white water rafting, zip-lining and kayaking. One evening, visit Chinotimba township for a local meal, cooked over an open fire in cast iron pots and ovens, giving guests an authentic, wholesome and tasty food experience.
Transfer to Victoria Falls airport for onward flight arrangements: you could extend your trip with time in Cape Town, or on the beach in Mozambique.

tourName: Zimbabwe tailor made holiday
placesVisited: Victoria Falls, Hwange National Park, Lake Kariba, Optional rhino tracking in Matusadona National Park
generalInfo:
Zimbabwe is a country of incredible beauty and wildlife, with a wide range of activities to suit every palate, from game drives to canoeing safaris, to adventurous activities such as bungee jumping and microlight flights. Not to mention the fact that the country’s guides are reputedly some of the best on the continent.

This Zimbabwe tailor made holiday will take you around the country’s main highlights. You’ll visit the mighty Victoria Falls, go on safari in Hwange National Park and explore Lake Kariba, where you can view wildlife from a 4WD, boat or on foot with an armed guide. Zimbabwe is excellent value for money as well as being a year-round destination, with plenty to see and do even in the wet season

dayInfo.description: Transfer today by road and light aircraft to Lake Kariba, where you stay for 3 nights on a full inclusive basis including all meals and two activities per day. Lake Kariba is one of the largest man-made lakes in Africa, created in the 1950’s by the development of Kariba Dam, to generate electricity for the population in Zambia and Zimbabwe. Lake Kariba is a genuine African wilderness with far more animals than people. This allows for glorious game viewing by boat as well as the traditional open 4 x 4 vehicles and walking in the wilds with an armed professional guide. There is also the option of tracking rhino in Matusadona National Park. Among the species that may be seen at Bumi are many elephants and buffalo, massive Nile crocodiles, lions, many hippo, the elusive leopard, kudu, water buck, impala, warthog, monkeys, baboons, sable, zebra
Return light aircraft transfer to Victoria Falls Airport for your overnight flight to London, via Johannesburg.

tourName: Zimbabwe tailor made holidays
generalInfo:
This classic Zimbabwe itinerary, with a luxurious twist, explores some of the country's finest lodges nestled within its game-rich and scenically stunning National Parks.

Designed to highlight the essence of Zimbabwe, this journey offers incredible wildlife encounters set against some of the most dramatic landscapes on Earth, complemented by safaris led by some of Africa's best guides. Starting in Victoria Falls, you’ll fly to the open plains of Hwange National Park, renowned as one of the best places in the world to see elephants, along with rarer species like roan and sable. From Hwange, your adventure continues by air to the expansive and awe-inspiring Lake Kariba, where you’ll stay at the breathtaking Bumi Hills Safari Lodge. The final leg of your journey takes you to the iconic Mana Pools National Park, famous for its diverse wildlife and stunning views of the Zambezi River, the lifeblood of the region.

dayInfo.description: Zimbabwe awaits Fly to Victoria Falls, via Johannesburg.

Hwange Arriving in Victoria Falls around lunchtime, you’ll be transferred by light aircraft to Hwange National Park, where you’ll enjoy a game drive en route to your lodge, Somalisa Camp. You’ll arrive in time for afternoon tea and have a moment to settle in before embarking on an afternoon game drive—an excellent way to get acquainted with the park and its stunning wildlife.

Explore Hwange Your time in Hwange promises to be truly unforgettable, with a range of activities available from Somalisa Camp, including game drives, guided walks, birding safaris, and visits to local villages. Throughout your stay, you’ll have the opportunity to spot a variety of wildlife, including lions, elephants, buffalo, cheetahs, and wild dogs. You may also encounter the majestic roan and sable antelope, two of Hwange’s most iconic and sought-after sights.

To Lake Kariba After a final morning safari and brunch in Hwange, you’ll be transferred back to the airstrip for your flight to Lake Kariba. The approach is truly spectacular, with the vast expanse of the lake gradually coming into view as you get closer. Arriving at Bumi Hills Safari Lodge in the late afternoon is ideal, allowing you to unwind on the lodge’s deck while watching the sun set over the shimmering waters of the lake.

Kariba With a wealth of activities available, you’ll have no shortage of things to do during your stay at Bumi Hills. Lake-based activities are a highlight of the daily program, with options including boat safaris, fishing trips, and sunset cruises. Additionally, game drives in the nearby Matusadona National Park provide another fantastic way to explore the area and make the most of your time at the lodge.

Along the river The flight schedule allows you to enjoy most of the day at Bumi Hills, where you can savor lunch on the deck before being transferred to the airstrip for a breathtaking flight along the Zambezi escarpment to Mana Pools National Park. Upon arrival, you'll be driven to the beautifully appointed Zambezi Expeditions Camp, a serene location overlooking the Zambezi River—an ideal setting to conclude your Zimbabwe adventure.

Big game and beautiful backdrops Mornings at Zambezi Expeditions begin with a delicious breakfast by the campfire before setting out to explore with your guide. As one of Africa’s top walking safari destinations, be sure to experience at least one walk. Game drives and canoe safaris along the mighty Zambezi are also available. For those interested, you can try your hand at fishing for Tiger Fish from the riverbanks – a perfect way to spend a relaxing afternoon. Return to the boat for evening sundowner drinks and dinner.
Homeward Bound This morning, you'll depart from Mana Pools and be flown back to Harare for your onward flights.

tourName: Zimbabwe wildlife holidays
placesVisited: Victoria Falls guided tour, Hwange National Park, Matusadona National Park, Mana Pools, walking safaris, game drives, game viewing from hides, boat cruises, canoeing, birding, cultural visits, fishing and dinosaur fossil trips, accommodation in tented camps, lodges and authentic bush camps
generalInfo:
This Zimbabwe wildlife holiday serves up the absolute best of Zimbabwe in an 11 day nutshell. See the spectacular Victoria Falls and enjoy an exciting range of wildlife viewing and cultural experiences, including walking safaris, game drives, boat cruises, canoeing, birding, cultural visits, fishing and dinosaur fossil trips.

The tour begins at Victoria Falls, where you can try a host of exhilarating adventure activities as well as taking a guided tour of the waterfall itself. Then, by road, you move on to Hwange National Park. This iconic park is renowned for its large populations of elephants and lions and here you’ll stay at an authentic bush camp overlooking the savannah plains of the Kennedy Vlei Line. Next, take a light aircraft flight to Matusadona National Park, where your accommodation is a privately run camp on an island in Lake Kariba. Finally, fly to the World Heritage area of Mana Pools and stay on the banks of the Lower Zambezi River. Game drives along the floodplain in open 4x4 vehicles are a highlight of your time here.

dayInfo.description: Victoria Falls: Arrive independently to Harry Mwanga Nkumbula International Airport in Livingstone and join your 30 minute transfer to the beautiful Thorntree River Lodge within the Mosi Oa Tunya National Park. Located in close proximity to Victoria Falls, your stay here will offer a wonderful combination of visits to the Falls and wildlife encounters in the National Park. At Victoria Falls, the earth splits open and swallows one of Africa’s greatest rivers, the mighty Zambezi, creating the largest sheet of falling water on earth. As the water hits the narrow depths of the Batoka Gorge beneath, it blasts a cloud of mist skywards, lending the falls their local name ‘mosi-oa-tunya’ (the smoke that thunders). When the Zambezi is at its fullest, the mist hangs a permanent raincloud above the falls, showering visitors on even the sunniest of days and visible for miles around. As part of your stay here you can enjoy a tour of the Zambian side of the Falls from which you can get a side on view of the falls and the Batoka Gorge. Various additional activities are available for an extra cost including white water rafting, bungee jumping, river cruises, helicopter flights and much more. With 2 included activities per day, you will want to take advantage of your unique location by joining game drives, walking safaris and boat cruises in search of the enigmatic wildlife that resides here. Romantic sunset river cruises, cultural village visits and museum tours complete the experience. 2 nights’ accommodation at Thorntree River Lodge on a fully-inclusive basis with all meals, local drinks and 2 activities per day included (game drives, walking safaris, boat cruises, village and museum visits & Victoria Falls Zambian Side Tour)

Hwange National Park: On the morning of day 3 you will transfer to the Victoria Falls International Airport for your shared charter flight to the Manga Airstrip in Hwange. From here you will transfer by road to the beautiful Somalisa Camp set within the heart of the unfenced and world-famous Hwange National Park. Upon arrival there should be time to settle into your comfortable lodgings before embarking on your first safari through these outstanding surroundings. Included in your stay, you can enjoy day & night game drives and walking safaris, and each day your guides will choose optimal routes for unforgettable wildlife encounters. Wherever you roam, you can hope for countless sightings of elephant, kudu, sable antelope, zebra, wildebeest, gemsbok, the rare and endangered roan antelope, buffalo, giraffe, white rhino, lion, leopard and hyena amongst many others. Exploring through Zimbabwe's largest National Park, home to more than 100 mammal species and over 350 bird species, this is sure to be an incredibly impressive wildlife experience accompanied by spectacular vistas of the ever-changing landscapes and habitats. During your time here there will also be opportunities for dedicated birdwatching, game viewing from the camp’s hides and cultural visits to local communities. Each evening you can return to the comforts of your fantastic lodge to enjoy delicious meals, sunset drinks and a great night’s sleep. 3 nights accommodation at Somalisa Camp on a fully-inclusive basis with all meals, local drinks, day & night game drives, walking safaris and birdwatching tours included.

Lake Kariba & Matusadona National Park: On day 6 you will transfer back to the Manga Airstrip for your shared charter flight to Bumi Hills where you will check into the Bumi Hills Safari Lodge. With stunning views over the atmospheric Lake Kariba, this enchanting lodge boasts an idyllic location where guests can spend their days gazing out over the shoreline where the elephants, buffaloes, zebras, wildebeest, impalas and more graze along one of the largest dams in the world. Around the lake, the healthy populations of hippo and crocodiles dot the waters and the sun-bleached trees that drowned all those years ago are still standing strong, breaking the surface to become birdlife magnets, especially for fish eagles, cormorants and other water birds. In nearby Matusadona National Park you can enjoy even more wildlife encounters where black rhinos, leopards and lions roam. Walking safaris and game drives in open safari vehicles accompanied by professional guides will see you gain inside knowledge of the best spots for game viewing, and game and sunset cruises will offer another perspective of these wild and wondrous lands. Night drives, cultural excursions, birding at Lake Kariba and fishing excursions are also on offer here, and we recommend booking the “lunch on Starvation Island” experience. 3 nights’ accommodation at Bumi Hills Safari Lodge on a fully-inclusive basis with all meals, local drinks and 2 activities per day included (game drives, safari walks, game and sunset boat cruises, fishing and village visits).

Mana Pools: On the morning of day 9 you will transfer back to the airstrip for your shared charter flight to the Mana Pools Airstrip. From here you will transfer to the delightful Nyamatusi Camp which is located on a private concession in the remote and pristine eastern area of Mana Pools National Park, offering you fantastic access to the wonders that the Park holds. Mana Pools is a designated UNESCO world heritage site and is a unique oasis often described as a ‘garden of Eden’. It is a remote gem that leaves you awed and humbled by the landscape, a landscape that feels both eternal and wonderfully alive. The name Mana means four in the Shona language and comes from a series of four pools, remnants of oxbow lakes that run parallel to the river amongst the ancient floodplains for which Mana is famous. These floodplains attract wildlife in huge numbers, and on your included walking and driving safaris you will have the chance to get up-close to some of these majestic animals. The area is known for its immense bull elephants and the sight of an elephant standing upon its hind legs to stretch for the seedpods of a giant Albida tree upon the floodplain has become iconic. Yet it’s not only elephants that you’ll be searching for. In the company of your expert guides, you can fully immerse yourself in your unforgettable surroundings, tracking everything from beetles to wild dogs and lions. With over 380 species of birds recorded, birdwatching is also incredible here! Lying along the tranquil banks of the Zambezi River, canoeing safaris are also a highlight here and offer a great way to get a unique perspective on the incredible scenery and marine wildlife such as hippos, crocodiles, elephants and a wide array of birds. Catch and release fishing tours are also available. 3 nights’ accommodation at Nyamatusi Camp on a fully-inclusive basis with all meals, local drinks, morning & afternoon game drives, guided walks, bird watching and canoeing safaris included.
After breakfast, transfer to Mana Pools airstrip for a flight to Harare for onward or return travel.

tourName: Best of Zimbabwe and Chobe Private Safari
placesVisited: Victoria Falls, Chobe National Park, Hwange National Park
generalInfo: Southern Africa is a rich tapestry of landscapes and wilderness that is stitched together by the migration of mammals along infamous rivers. Dramatic spectacles burst from their seams as habitats are dyed their distinctive colors, and nature's fabric weaves from dense, mystical forests to the open savanna. This exclusive safari itinerary journeys to the heart of Africa and connects three of its most diverse experiences: Victoria Falls, Chobe National Park, and Hwange National Park.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - The Dramatic Spectacle of the Falls
dayInfo.description: You can hear Victoria Falls from your lodge, and it’s a low growl, an endless thunder that arrives on the breeze. You are just a few miles upriver, and you can gaze over the rapids and watch the monkey troops that impishly swing past. After your flight and transfer, there will be some time to relax and refresh before you are escorted to the park gate. You will pass the raucous baboons that guard the entrance to walking trail, and you will feel as though your adventure has truly begun. Victoria Falls divides Zimbabwe and Zambia, but two-thirds of the spectacle is on the Zimbabwean side. The first ten minutes of the trail bring iconic views as the tumbling water is usually enhanced by a 360-degree rainbow. Travel further across the canyon, and there will be no tree canopy for cover as you stand face to face with the falls to feel the spray that rises from the canyon as you marvel at the spectacle's power. Other waterfalls may be higher and wider, but none dispense as much water as this one does. After taking it all in, you will be returned to your lodge, and a sunset Zambezi cruise will bring your first day in Africa to a close.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - Micro Flight Above the Falls and Afternoon in Livingstone
dayInfo.description: This morning you will cruise above Victoria Falls on a small plane that will provide impressive views of the river and the canyon. Colors swirl on nature's canvas below, and you will admire cataracts that stand tall in the Lower Zambezi. Touch down, and your guide will take you over the bridge and into Zambia, where you will walk alongside another part of the falls, taking bridges to the cataracts that are often enshrouded in mist. Dependent on the Zambezi River water levels, you can also take a boat towards the edge of the precipice. Spend a couple of hours in the town of Livingstone to visit a traditional market and a number of colonial buildings from the time of the explorer that gave the town its name, David Livingstone. Returning to Zimbabwe, a sunset cruise is included in your lodge stay and makes for another peaceful and serene evening.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - Kayaking and Exploring the Zambezi
dayInfo.description: The Zambezi is one of Africa's great waterways and a river that brings life to a dry and dusty land. Hippos rest in the slow-moving pools as sometimes dozens of them will congregate with their enormous jaws and bellowing grunts. Nile crocodiles bask in the sun, lining the banks with an eery menace. Baboons and various monkey species scurry across the ground, while a handful of different antelope come down for a drink. You will spend the day exploring the river, with your morning spent on a kayak tour and your afternoon on a luxurious boat as canapes and cocktails are served as the wildlife roams past. With six days of safari beginning tomorrow, your time spent on the water will be a perfect introduction to the landscape and a chance to relax before your safari adventure continues.

dayInfo.title: Chobe National Park - Drifting Down the Chobe River
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will drift down the Chobe River and relax on your viewing deck hoping to see hundreds of elephants play along the banks. Lounging back, you can watch giraffe and zebra come for a drink with a massive pod of hippos barging about just after them. Slowly, you will journey deeper into the wilderness with the open grasslands of Namibia to one side and the thick woodland of Botswana to the other. Zebra emerge and splash in the shallows, buffalo keep their heads and horns clear of the water, and you will disembark into the forest. The animals cannot see you, and you can turn a corner to find a herd of elephants soon surrounding your vehicle. Turn another, and you may be just three meters from a tower of giraffes. Buffalos may soon cover the trail, and you will have to stop to allow them to pass. Your luxury camp is deep in the wilderness and surrounded by the woodland's natural orchestra. With a safari in Chobe, you will be engaged at all times of the day and night.

dayInfo.title: Chobe National Park - Be Surrounded by Elephants
dayInfo.description: In Chobe National Park, you will never escape the elephants. Youngsters use their trunks as snorkels, big males face off in the forest, and all of their eyes reveal emotion. You will see the melancholy of old bulls that wander lonely, and then admire the enthusiasm of youth as the glint of discovery coats the expression of younger elephants. Take in the thoughtfulness of the matriarchs, as their eyes and subtle smiles impress from all angles. Today's game drives will take you indelibly close to it all, both the pachyderms and the predators in the trees. You will cross a large section of Chobe and discover what hides beneath the canopy. Choose from morning and afternoon drives, or a full day that heads out to the remote Savute area of the park.

dayInfo.title: Chobe National Park - Walking and Driving
dayInfo.description: It can be scary to swap wheels for walking boots when there are so many elephants around, but the locals have lived alongside four-legged giants for generations, and they know how to plot a safe route through the herds. In a private concession on the edge of Chobe, you will enjoy a morning walking safari as your journey begins in dense woodland and then opens out onto open grasslands. Here you will find the grazers in huge numbers with the zebra and red lechwe among those that are scattered for as far as the eye can see. Moving patiently and quietly, you will be able to get exceptionally close with your focus switching from a giant herd to a small individual. After lunch, your privately guided safari will continue with a game drive back towards Zimbabwe as you follow muddy trails through Chobe's remote southern woodland. This region of the national park sees few vehicles, and part of your experience will be to stop in the middle of the woodland and wait for the animals. From your silent vantage point, it will be easy to spend hours taking in all the intimate details ranging from lone springboks with faces of anxiety, graceful giraffe towers that hold their heads up high and majestic lions on route to the water.

dayInfo.title: Hwange National Park - On the Trail of Zimbabwe's Big Cats
dayInfo.description: Where Chobe is dense and intimate, Hwange is open and expressive. The visibility within the region is seemingly endless as every 360-degree panorama is dappled with animals. There are few places for animals to hide, so the ungulates live by safety in numbers. There are over 100 types of mammals to find, from the world-famous giants to the unusual characters that you will rarely see outside Hwange National Park. Your lodge will be in the center of the park and provide easy access to diverse ecosystems. As with most privately guided safaris, you can choose from a collection of activities and schedules. In Hwange, you can also choose the type of habitat and animals that you would most like to see. Explore miombo woodland and seek out the park's legendary leopards, or cross the open grass plains to find lion prides in abundance. Follow the curves of the river to find its residents, or journey onto the Kalahari-style desert to discover the migratory giants.

dayInfo.title: Hwange National Park - The Iconic Big-Game Safari Experience
dayInfo.description: You will explore grasslands where animals are more scattered as they do not need to congregate around the water. Impala skip past, eland bashfully gather together, a sable antelope's horns may bring an iconic photo, and soon you will be able to identify a dozen different antelopes. As everywhere in Hwange, these antelopes are not seen in isolation as interaction is everywhere. You can listen to baboons give a warning call to the grazers below, and then watch sentinels raise the alarm as a hundred heads jump up from the grass. You could smell the fear and imagine that a leopard is lurking nearby, which is what makes an African safari so different from simply being at the zoo. There are no fences and no script, just the magic of the wild.

dayInfo.title: Hwange National Park - Iconic Encounters in Hwange
dayInfo.description: Hwange has been a protected park for over a century and was formerly a royal hunting ground. The region has been a national park since 1929 and covers an area bigger than the Serengeti. With so few visitors, it will feel like a private concession. You might encounter lions on a hunt and nothing else will interrupt your photos, and then spend an hour watching playful hippos without another vehicle in sight. As you explore, you will realize that safari is not just about the most famous animals as it is also about all of the endemic species and intricate details such as the glint in an eye, the expression on a face, and the beautiful sounds that keep you company through the night.

dayInfo.title: Hwange National Park - Departure
dayInfo.description: Your final morning on safari will give you a chance to take in the giants one last time before leaving the wilderness. On an extended game drive, you will loop across Hwange on route to the airstrip, where a domestic flight will bring you back to Victoria Falls Airport and your international departure.

tourName: Best of Zimbabwe Safari: Exclusive Camps and Experiences
placesVisited: Matetsi Private Game Reserve, Victoria Falls, Zambezi River, Hwange National Park, Lake Kariba, Matusadona National Park, Matobo Hills National Park, Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve, Gonarezhou National Park, The Great Limpopo Transfrontier Park
generalInfo: Zimbabwe has always offered exceptional big-game safari, with intimate encounters with black and white rhinos, thousands of elephants, and exclusive concessions and thrilling game walks. New luxury camps and private reserves have opened in the last few years, as the country’s safari industry has been re-energized. These highlights of Zimbabwe safaris celebrate Zimbabwe’s new and exclusive experiences, including aerial charters, modern luxury camps, and wonderful wildlife encounters.

dayInfo.title: Matetsi Private Game Reserve - Safari from Your Suite
dayInfo.description: In the Sotho language, Victoria Falls is known as Mosi-oa-Tunya, translated as “The Smoke that Thunders.” This name is stunningly appropriate, the roaring Zambezi River tumbling into a mist-filled chasm, sending clouds of condensation hundreds of meters into the air. Even from your lodge, 24 miles upriver, it’s possible to see the spray and hear the dramatic growl of the water. Matetsi Private Game Reserve has 17 miles of private river frontage and over 50,000 hectares of pristine wilderness. This safari oasis is within easy reach of the falls, yet fully surrounded by Zimbabwe’s four-legged wildlife. You’re greeted at the airport and transferred to your river lodge. Safari is private here, and you watch animals directly from your river-facing suite; hippos quarreling, baboons playing, zebras grazing, and buffalos wandering as you dip into the private plunge pool on your verandah. There’s also a fabulous circular bath that looks out over the Zambezi, a lazy space for recovering from the flight.

dayInfo.title: Matetsi Private Game Reserve - Downriver to Victoria Falls, Upriver to the Hippos
dayInfo.description: You’re in the perfect location here to access Victoria Falls. Travel downriver, and the growl of Victoria Falls looms louder. Stop at an island close to the precipice then explore the walking trails around the falls, enjoying wonderful vistas over a mile-wide sheet of water that plummets over 100 meters into the chasm. Or take a boat upriver, where pods of hippos wade through the shallows and migratory elephants are never far away. Transfers to the falls are included, and you can choose when you want to see the spectacle. For the rest of the time, the safari continues all around you, Springboks, and impalas among those that scamper past as you’re lounging on the verandah.

dayInfo.title: Hwange National Park - Following the Elephants Through the Wilderness
dayInfo.description: It’s a short flight south to Hwange, the light aircraft swooping over western Zimbabwe’s unbroken wilderness, low enough to spot herds of elephants traveling in and out of the woodland. You touch down in Zimbabwe’s longstanding and largest national park, Hwange National Park, a flagship destination on an astonishing scale. Enormous herds of elephants and buffalos roam here, sometimes hundreds of them seen in a single panorama. Gemsboks graze as packs of rare brown hyenas form. One of Africa’s largest populations of wild dogs can be found close to the camp, thriving on a floodplain in the heart of Hwange. This is a classic big game safari and the next three days are all about the expressions of wild Africa. Two game-viewing activities are included each day, and the camp’s central location allows you to explore the park’s diverse habitats and animals.

dayInfo.title: Hwange National Park - Decadent Big-Game Safari
dayInfo.description: Wake to elephants, trumpeting far across the plains. Game drive at dawn, tracking a pride of black-maned lions on the prowl. The sun is rising, and the predators are getting desperate, lunging unsuccessfully at zebras. Wildebeests canter past, full of energy. Buffalos fill a waterhole, grunting and slurping without pause. It’s impossible to keep track of the elephants, especially when you journey north into the woodlands. Game drive south and the Kalahari Desert plains attract a rich abundance of antelope: bushbuck, eland, kudu, gemsbok, reedbuck, hartebeest, impala, steenbok, duiker, and more. This wide-ranging menu creates food for the complete cast of predators, and a 3-day safari is a great chance to see the iconic combination of lion, leopard, cheetah, wild dog, and hyena. Sometimes they’re resting, but often you follow them as they hunt and explore.

dayInfo.title: Hwange National Park - Luxury Tented Safari
dayInfo.description: Providing a calm space after the wildlife drama is your next camp, where there’s a real luxury to safari under canvas. Sounds drift through the canvas walls, keeping you firmly immersed in the events of the bush. En-suite bathrooms feature beautiful alfresco bush showers, where you sometimes look out onto elephants. A pool and verandah overlook a flooded pan, which is lit up in the evenings. Evenings are majestic here, with a fine dining menu served as all manner of animals meet at the water below, while a soaring canopy of trees ensures none of them get too close to your wine glasses.

dayInfo.title: Lake Kariba - Private Aerial Safari
dayInfo.description: Take a flight north, the first of your chartered light aircraft journeys across Zimbabwe. These flights hop from wilderness to wilderness while offering sublime impressions of the landscapes down below. As you land, you spot herds and giants on the plains and then disembark to giraffes and buffalos close to the dusty airstrip. Backdropped by rugged mountains, Matusadona is a destination of remarkable beauty, where every panorama is a potential photograph. Stay at Changa Safari Camp on the shores of Lake Kariba, a camp that epitomizes ideas of waterfront escapism. Your spacious tented suite has a private deck overlooking the water, with curved stairs leading down to a wide beach and a large fire pit, where the warming flames are constant throughout the evenings. Some aspects of the Lake Kariba experience are reminiscent of a typical waterfront getaway. Boat safaris take you past a rich array of birdlife, while storks and fish eagles are familiar sights around your suite. It’s easy to spend lazy hours on the beach, watching the hippos and buffalos along the banks. And that’s where Lake Kariba is so different, this unique fusion of big game activity and waterfront tranquility.

dayInfo.title: Lake Kariba - Evocative Wildlife Encounters
dayInfo.description: Walk across the plains, surrounding yourself with zebras and waterbucks, admiring the horns of rare sables and roan antelopes. Cruise on the water, watching how the herons flit in and out of the hippo pods. Drive into the park and stop in a clearing, waiting for elephants and a dense concentration of lions to get close. This is a park with a full range of activities, and it’s compact enough to include all three modes of exploration in one day. Serene and sublime, it’s a park that helps keep you energized on a multi-day safari, while simultaneously continuing the big mammal encounters.

dayInfo.title: Matobo Hills National Park - Walking Amongst Black and White Rhinos
dayInfo.description: Enjoy a relaxed morning on the lakeshore before you fly south to Bulawayo, a short transfer away from the World Heritage Site of Matobo Hills. Remarkably high concentrations of leopards and black eagles occupy the jagged granite scenery, thriving in the broken landscapes. Other mammals are prolific in compact areas of open plains, including both black and white rhino subspecies. Today’s exploration is dedicated to the endangered giants, a conservationist leading you on a drive into the rhinos’ realm. Watch in awe as the white rhinos rumble past, fierce, and determined in their movements. Then wait patiently to see the smaller and shier black rhinos, which only emerge when they’re confident. From the vehicle, you continue on foot, a very rare chance to share the landscape with Africa’s most iconic endangered species.

dayInfo.title: Matobo Hills National Park - Intrigue Within World’s View
dayInfo.description: Cecil Rhodes called these hills “World’s View.” It’s not difficult to see why, especially when you walk to the summit of the granite domes and castle kopjes . Up here, you find San rock art, history etched into caves and overhangs, interpreted by your local guide. Many of the paintings tell of wildlife nearby, and the hills continue to offer some majestic safari encounters. Walks are short and relaxed, exploring a compact area popular with different antelopes. Drives bounce into the hills, in search of the legendary leopard population. And when the black eagles soar, the guides know that there’s something intriguing down below, usually, a decomposing carcass fought over by scavengers. Your camp is a tranquil base for these activities, hidden in an ancient Bushmen shelter, with a swimming pool and bar overlooking a waterhole.

dayInfo.title: Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve - The Opulence of a Private Zimbabwean Safari
dayInfo.description: Completing the safari is one of Southern Africa’s ultimate private reserves. The Great Limpopo Transfrontier Park is Africa’s largest protected area, spanning three countries and incorporating many reserves and parks. Most famously, this area includes South Africa’s Sabi Sands and the Kruger. There are no fences and animals move freely, with Zimbabwe’s section of the park just as rich in the big game as South Africa’s (the Mozambican side was heavily targeted by poachers during a long civil war, forcing many animals into South Africa and Zimbabwe). In particular, this is a haven for some of Africa’s largest elephants, big-tusked and often aggressive males, along with scores of rhinos and predators. Fly here and settle into the serenity of the safari experience, with twice-daily game drives complemented by game walks and boat cruises on the lake. This is Zimbabwe’s best private reserve, and there’s a very personal side to the safari as if the wilderness has become your own back garden.

dayInfo.title: Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve - A Full Day in Southern Africa’s Gonarezhou National Park
dayInfo.description: While Malilangwe is charming and compact, neighboring Gonarezhou is vast and unpredictable. It’s one of Africa’s final unknowns, a landscape of red valleys and roving woodlands, where animals react differently to the other reserves you’ve visited. Large mammals are more aggressive, fiercely protecting their realm. Antelopes can be skittish, and you see them kicking up dust, galloping in large herds. Gonarezhou is another part of The Great Limpopo Transfrontier Park and is a full-day trip from Malilangwe, with guides bringing a picnic for the journey. This is an optional activity, and you may choose to spend the day in the more relaxed private reserve.

dayInfo.title: Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve - Relaxing Final Day of Luxury Safari
dayInfo.description: The final day of the safari and you really appreciate the allure of Zimbabwe. It’s not just the animals and their interactions with each other, how the predators battle amongst themselves, and the smaller species bow down to an elephant’s giant footsteps. It’s the privacy of the experience, with so few other people in such a huge landscape. Almost always, you’re alone in wild Africa, watching hippos or lions without another vehicle spoiling the backdrop. This privacy is further enhanced by the flexibility of the safari program, as you tailor each day to your own interests, whether long adventurous drives or tranquil hours on foot or on the water.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg - Departure
dayInfo.description: Logistics also make Malilangwe a good place to finish a Zimbabwean safari. From here, there are scheduled flights across the border to O. R. Tambo International in Johannesburg, the biggest airport in Africa. After breakfast and the short flight, you then transfer to your homebound departure at O. R. Tambo International.

tourName: Best of Zimbabwe Safari in 12 Days
placesVisited: Victoria Falls, Mana Pools National Park, Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve
generalInfo: Zimbabwe’s diverse wilderness and rich heritage are yours to discover during this thrilling 12-day adventure in Victoria Falls, Mana Pools National Park, and Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve. Admire the jaw-dropping world wonder Victoria Falls from lofty viewpoints, the immense bushveld veiling Mana Pools, gorgeous glistening channels of the Zambezi River, and inspiring wildlife wandering Malilangwe’s flourishing and nourishing environments along the way.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - Welcome to Untamed Africa
dayInfo.description: You will clear through customs and immigration on arrival in Victoria Falls Airport, Zimbabwe, meet your private transfer, and head for a kitted-out safari lodge tucked away in the bushveld overlooking the Zambezi River. This luxurious lodge is situated around the corner from Victoria Falls amongst the sprawling natural wilderness that encompasses unspoiled Zimbabwe. As you unpack your things, you will be treated to backdrops of buffalo, zebra, and eland roaming the pastures beneath your patio. You will also relish your first safari drive this afternoon that will welcome you to untamed Africa.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - Marvelous Scenes of Victoria Falls
dayInfo.description: You will appreciate the breathtaking forested scenery en route to the falls this morning and soon arrive at the summit of the massive gorge. An enormous sheet of falling water will thunder into the Zambezi River below, spraying the air with a thick mist responsible for the fall’s nickname, The Smoke that Thunders. Rainbows will reveal themselves in the spray, and you will feel the refreshing showers from your lofty observation point. You will return to camp afterward and enjoy an afternoon cruise across the Zambezi River, showcasing the spellbinding orange African sunset.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools National Park - Eye-Opening Safaris with a Bushveld Specialist
dayInfo.description: You will meet your specialist guide after breakfast at the airport and catch a charter flight to a quiet airstrip in Mana Pools National Park. As you touch down, you will jump into a decked-out 4x4 vehicle and partake in a safari drive en route to camp. Typical African highlights such as zebras, buffaloes, and warthogs gathering around waterholes, herds of elephants plodding across the green pastures, and lions lounging in the shade of acacia trees await your discovery in Mana Pools. You will arrive at your glamorous camp this evening for an open-fire-cooked Zimbabwean dinner.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools National Park - Big Five Safari Drives in Zimbabwe
dayInfo.description: There are several ways to explore Mana Pools National Park that you may revel in during your stay, with morning and afternoon game drives being the archetypal method of venturing quickly through the bushveld in search of significant animal sightings. Your journey will allow you to absorb the diverse wilderness scenery from many angles and appreciate the moments of peace and quiet amongst the untouched Zimbabwean landscapes. You will hear the cackle of wild dogs and moans of wallowing hippos as you peruse the park, hoping to spot the Big Five and much more.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools National Park - Marvelous Safaris in Mana Pools
dayInfo.description: Nature walks along forest trails and canoeing trips across the Zambezi’s web of waterways are unique safari experiences you will relish today. In the morning, an armed ranger will lead you through the bushveld, and you will encounter the natural environment closer than ever before. You will spot the tracks of big cats moving across the dirt paths and catch wafts of fragrant flowers blooming between the shrubbery. Your tour will bring you to the banks of the Zambezi, where you will climb into a canoe and glide across the blue ribbons of the river.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools National Park - Riveting Ruwesi Canoe Trails
dayInfo.description: You will spend another two nights in Mana Pools National Park, only this time on the banks of the Zambezi River in glamping style tents set up for you once you arrive by canoe at each stop-off point on the adventurous Ruwesi Canoe Trails. After a safety briefing in the morning, you will head off across the Zambezi onboard your canoe and paddle gently along sparkling streams with views of Mana Pool’s breathtaking scenery. Arriving at camp, you will soak up your campsite’s bewitching backdrops and savor a delectable dinner under the stars.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools National Park - Adventures on the Banks of the Zambezi
dayInfo.description: You will galavant across more of the Zambezi River today from camp, enjoying the remarkable wilderness scenes and game viewing opportunities presented along the banks of the sapphire channels. You may spot elephants wandering to the river for a sip of water, birds of prey circling the sky in search of food, and hippos standing on little isles rising above the water’s surface during your paddle across the Zambezi. You will return to camp in the afternoon and listen to enrapturing wildlife stories from your knowledgeable guide while you gaze upon the crystal clear night sky.

dayInfo.title: Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve - First-Class Shangaan Safari Escape
dayInfo.description: After a morning game viewing stroll and breakfast, you will transfer to the local airstrip and catch your charter flight to the Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve. You will retreat to a stunning lodge in one of Zimbabwe’s most alluring natural environments, boasting suites that overlook the rolling emerald hills and glistening strips of water. You may spend your afternoon adoring the first-class amenities at your accommodation, from wallowing in your private plunge pool to admiring the local Shangaan art and culture.

dayInfo.title: Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve - Magic Game Drives in Malilangwe
dayInfo.description: There is an abundance of game viewing activities available to you in Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve, and you will be thrilled to partake in several safari drives during your stay. You will cross the plains in state-of-the-art Land Cruisers during day and night drives, each sharing unique encounters with the wildlife. During the day, you will spot an abundance of diurnal creatures, including elephants, hippos, zebra, wildebeest, buck, and more. When night envelopes the reserve, you will capture Malilangwe’s nocturnal activity, including hunting predators, bright-eyed bush babies, and wandering civets, to name a few.

dayInfo.title: Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve - The Ancient Lives of the Shangaan People
dayInfo.description: Today, you may learn more about the local Zimbabwean heritage and culture during a community visit to a local Shangaan village. You will witness the impressive conservation efforts of the indigenous people as well as their distinct lifestyles first-hand during your tour. Afterward, you may visit world-famous ancient San bushmen settlements revealing the country’s significant past through cave paintings and fascinating fables. You may also partake in ethical catch and release fishing to discover what it may have been like as a hunter-gatherer centuries ago.

dayInfo.title: Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve - Treat Yourself in the Bushveld
dayInfo.description: Beyond safari experiences, Malilangwe offers guests plenty of time to sit back and unwind in one of Zimbabwe’s premier wildlife paradises. Today, you may savor the delectable flavors of some of the world’s best wines imported and stocked at your lavish lodge. Your private sommelier will guide you through the tasting, sharing their knowledge of wines and qualities that constitute the best vintages. Afterward, you may lap up a sundowner cruise across the river with canapés and decadent cocktails. As the stars pierce the night sky, you will relish some incredible stargazing in Malilangwe.

dayInfo.title: Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve - Peaceful Mornings in Malilangwe
dayInfo.description: A morning game drive across Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve once you have packed your bags after breakfast will punctuate your enchanting African escape in Zimbabwe. You will enjoy your final few hours capturing more phenomenal wildlife scenes and appreciating each new game sighting as you venture to the reserve’s exit and continue to the airport to catch your flight home. You will board your plane, soar into the Zimbabwean sky, look back down on the sprawling wilderness sanctuary, and reminisce about your stunning safari experience.

tourName: Exclusive Zimbabwe Safari: The Best Camps for Africa's Most Authentic Safari
placesVisited: Victoria Falls, Hwange National Park, Lake Kariba, Mutusadona National Park, Matobo Hills, Malilangwe Wildlife Reserve
generalInfo: This 13-day safari will handpick the finest camps for Zimbabwe's ultimate big game adventure and immerse all your senses as you visit Victoria Falls, Hwange, Lake Kariba, Matobo Hills and Malilangwe. Black and white rhinos march past luxury camps, lions chase the sable antelope along the river, and you will lose track of the number of elephant herds that come into view. Celebrate Zimbabwe's natural grandeur during your luxury experience.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls – Legends and Fables Along the Zambezi River
dayInfo.description: With its baritone growl and misting spray, Victoria Falls captures the drama of wild Zimbabwe, and with its old-world glamour, the Stanley and Livingstone celebrates the country's charm. Tucked away in a private game reserve, it is just a short drive from the famous waterfalls, and this boutique hotel will gently ease you into the African experience. Lounge in your hot tub as zebra drink from the river below, and then sip premium wines as the enduring orange sun disappears from the sky. Listen to antelopes grazing outside your door and spend the evenings around a crackling fire. There is a colonial grandeur to the hotel that evokes a certain era and style, yet the promise of the wilderness is not interrupted, and you will quickly get acquainted with a wide collection of animals. You will be greeted upon arrival at Victoria Falls International Airport for a short transfer to the Stanley and Livingstone. The rest of the day is at your leisure, and there are plenty of places to relax with panoramic views, including the heated plunge pool. Local guides can take you on short walks around the game reserve to slowly introducing you to the animals of Zimbabwe. As with each stop on this safari, all meals are included, and you can expect an extremely high level of quality with creative fine dining served in inspiring settings. The next day will be all about Victoria Falls. Dependent on the river level, you can take a boat to an island next to the precipice as the rising spray and the deafening rumble hint at the spectacle's power. A self-guided walkway will lead you past numerous baboon troops and take you to beautiful lookout points. From these viewpoints, you can capture the full mile-wide sheet of water and admire how it disappears into the narrowest of canyons. For the ultimate vista, you can take a micro flight above Victoria Falls that will also reveal the distinctive landscapes of four countries: Zimbabwe, Zambia, Botswana and Namibia.

dayInfo.title: Hwange National Park – The Thrilling Authenticity of Big-Game Safari
dayInfo.description: Elephants define the panorama in Hwange, Zimbabwe's largest national park as they roam in huge herds and follow the ancient migratory routes between the Kalahari and the Zambezi. On your game drive transfer to your luxury lodge, you will already begin to lose track of how many elephant herds you have seen. You will have flown from Victoria Falls to the small Hwange airstrip, a convenient flight that maximizes your time on the savanna. For many years, this park was a private royal hunting ground for Nbedele warrior King Mzilikazi, and it has been a protected national park since 1929 and a premier safari destination. But elephants are just the start, as over these three days, you will find over 100 mammal species to discover. The diversity is what makes Hwange so special. Cheetahs run across the desert sands and towards the antelopes that huddle around waterholes. Lions bask on granite rocky outcrops, imperious predators that watch you closely even as they appear to be sleeping. Giraffe and elephant dominate the woodland, their irrevocable presence also found in the scarred remains of uprooted trees. Gemsbok and brown hyenas battle on open grasslands and the echoed drumbeat of the escaping herds float all the way to your camp. Such distinctive habitats create a very rounded safari experience, with each day exploring a diverse ecosystem with its own collection of specialist animals. At the heart of it all is your next safari property. Elegant and unassuming, the camp does not interrupt the atmosphere of the landscape. Animals graze in and around your luxury tented suite, the perfect sight as you open your curtains to watch the dusk fade into the night. You will sleep with your ears open to the savanna and hear distant lion calls and the harmonious shouts of primates in the distance. Meals are served beneath the stars, with the odd elephant or giraffe painted along the horizon. Hide Safari is a classic safari camp with just a small handful of tented suites amongst open miles of wilderness. Each day is privately guided, and you can choose your pace. The classic program is to explore in the early morning and late afternoon, leaving a few hours to relax at the camp around lunch time. But on a private game drive, you can also spend your whole day exploring as you head out into remote corners. Watch lions and leopards on the hunt and admire dozens of ungulates within reach of a waterhole, and then follow the prints to seek out rare wild dogs. There are also options for game walks as you follow designated routes that will bring close to the park's different ungulates. With privately guided activities, you can tailor each day to your interests as your guide will lead you through these three days that will unravel the pure authenticity of an African safari.

dayInfo.title: Lake Kariba – Lions and Hippos Along the Waterfront
dayInfo.description: Wake to the sounds of elephants and watch the babies as they swing their trunks past the camp. Enjoy your final breakfast in Hwange as you sip an artisan coffee as the giants of Africa rumble past. From here, you will board a light aircraft to the shores of Lake Kariba, where the isolated Matusadona National Park provides your next two days of safari. Buffalo congregate in the thousands as they line the shoreline as pods of hippos fill the center of the lake. Waterbuck and roan antelope graze close by, providing ample food for the famous collection of resident leopards.
